verses.text_plain: And it came to pass, when the Lord would take up Elijah into heaven by a whirlwind, that Elijah went with Elisha from Gilgal.
verses.verse_html: 1And it came to pass, when the Lord would take up Elijah into heaven by a whirlwind, that Elijah went with Elisha from Gilgal.

tokens.text: And it came to pass, when the Lord

verses.text_plain: And Elijah said unto Elisha, Tarry here, I pray thee; for the Lord hath sent me to Beth–el. And Elisha said unto him, As the Lord liveth, and as thy soul liveth, I will not leave thee. So they went down to Beth–el.
verses.verse_html: 2And Elijah said unto Elisha, Tarry here, I pray thee; for the Lord hath sent me to Beth–el. And Elisha said unto him, As the Lord liveth, and as thy soul liveth, I will not leave thee. So they went down to Beth–el.

tokens.text: here, I pray thee; for the Lord

verses.text_plain: And the sons of the prophets that were at Beth–el came forth to Elisha, and said unto him, Knowest thou that the Lord will take away thy master from thy head to day? And he said, Yea, I know it; hold ye your peace.
verses.verse_html: 3And the sons of the prophets that were at Beth–el came forth to Elisha, and said unto him, Knowest thou that the Lord will take away thy master from thy head to day? And he said, Yea, I know it; hold ye your peace.

verses.text_plain: And Elijah said unto him, Elisha, tarry here, I pray thee; for the Lord hath sent me to Jericho. And he said, As the Lord liveth, and as thy soul liveth, I will not leave thee. So they came to Jericho.
verses.verse_html: 4And Elijah said unto him, Elisha, tarry here, I pray thee; for the Lord hath sent me to Jericho. And he said, As the Lord liveth, and as thy soul liveth, I will not leave thee. So they came to Jericho.

tokens.text: here, I pray thee; for the Lord

verses.text_plain: And the sons of the prophets that were at Jericho came to Elisha, and said unto him, Knowest thou that the Lord will take away thy master from thy head to day? And he answered, Yea, I know it; hold ye your peace.
verses.verse_html: 5And the sons of the prophets that were at Jericho came to Elisha, and said unto him, Knowest thou that the Lord will take away thy master from thy head to day? And he answered, Yea, I know it; hold ye your peace.

verses.text_plain: And Elijah said unto him, Tarry, I pray thee, here; for the Lord hath sent me to Jordan. And he said, As the Lord liveth, and as thy soul liveth, I will not leave thee. And they two went on.
verses.verse_html: 6And Elijah said unto him, Tarry, I pray thee, here; for the Lord hath sent me to Jordan. And he said, As the Lord liveth, and as thy soul liveth, I will not leave thee. And they two went on.

tokens.text: I pray thee, here; for the Lord

verses.text_plain: And fifty men of the sons of the prophets went, and stood to view afar off: and they two stood by Jordan.
verses.verse_html:
7And fifty men of the sons of the prophets went, and stood to view afar off: and they two stood by Jordan. ▼
▼ to view: Heb. in sight, or, over against

footnotes.body_text: ▼ to view: Heb. in sight, or, over against
footnotes.body_html: ▼ to view: Heb. in sight, or, over against

verses.text_plain: And Elijah took his mantle, and wrapped it together, and smote the waters, and they were divided hither and thither, so that they two went over on dry ground.
verses.verse_html: 8And Elijah took his mantle, and wrapped it together, and smote the waters, and they were divided hither and thither, so that they two went over on dry ground.

tokens.text: hither and thither, so that they two

verses.text_plain: And it came to pass, when they were gone over, that Elijah said unto Elisha, Ask what I shall do for thee, before I be taken away from thee. And Elisha said, I pray thee, let a double portion of thy spirit be upon me.
verses.verse_html: 9And it came to pass, when they were gone over, that Elijah said unto Elisha, Ask what I shall do for thee, before I be taken away from thee. And Elisha said, I pray thee, let a double portion of thy spirit be upon me.

tokens.text: And it came to pass, when they were gone over
for thee, before I be taken away
I pray thee, let a double

verses.text_plain: And he said, Thou hast asked a hard thing: nevertheless, if thou see me when I am taken from thee, it shall be so unto thee; but if not, it shall not be so.
verses.verse_html:
10And he said, Thou hast asked a hard thing: nevertheless, if thou see me when I am taken from thee, it shall be so unto thee; but if not, it shall not be so. ▼
▼ Thou hast…: Heb. Thou hast done hard in asking

footnotes.body_text: ▼ Thou hast…: Heb. Thou hast done hard in asking
footnotes.body_html: ▼ Thou hast…: Heb. Thou hast done hard in asking

verses.text_plain: And it came to pass, as they still went on, and talked, that, behold, there appeared a chariot of fire, and horses of fire, and parted them both asunder; and Elijah went up by a whirlwind into heaven.
verses.verse_html: 11And it came to pass, as they still went on, and talked, that, behold, there appeared a chariot of fire, and horses of fire, and parted them both asunder; and Elijah went up by a whirlwind into heaven.

tokens.text: And it came to pass, as they still

verses.text_plain: And Elisha saw it, and he cried, My father, my father, the chariot of Israel, and the horsemen thereof. And he saw him no more: and he took hold of his own clothes, and rent them in two pieces.
verses.verse_html: 12And Elisha saw it, and he cried, My father, my father, the chariot of Israel, and the horsemen thereof. And he saw him no more: and he took hold of his own clothes, and rent them in two pieces.

tokens.text: him no more: and he took hold

verses.text_plain: He took up also the mantle of Elijah that fell from him, and went back, and stood by the bank of Jordan;
verses.verse_html:
13He took up also the mantle of Elijah that fell from him, and went back, and stood by the bank of Jordan; ▼
▼ bank: Heb. lip

verses.text_plain: And he took the mantle of Elijah that fell from him, and smote the waters, and said, Where is the Lord God of Elijah? and when he also had smitten the waters, they parted hither and thither: and Elisha went over.
verses.verse_html: 14And he took the mantle of Elijah that fell from him, and smote the waters, and said, Where is the Lord God of Elijah? and when he also had smitten the waters, they parted hither and thither: and Elisha went over.

tokens.text: and when he also had smitten

verses.text_plain: And when the sons of the prophets which were to view at Jericho saw him, they said, The spirit of Elijah doth rest on Elisha. And they came to meet him, and bowed themselves to the ground before him.
verses.verse_html: 15And when the sons of the prophets which were to view at Jericho saw him, they said, The spirit of Elijah doth rest on Elisha. And they came to meet him, and bowed themselves to the ground before him.

verses.text_plain: And they said unto him, Behold now, there be with thy servants fifty strong men; let them go, we pray thee, and seek thy master: lest peradventure the Spirit of the Lord hath taken him up, and cast him upon some mountain, or into some valley. And he said, Ye shall not send.
verses.verse_html:
16And they said unto him, Behold now, there be with thy servants fifty strong men; let them go, we pray thee, and seek thy master: lest peradventure the Spirit of the Lord hath taken him up, and cast him upon some mountain, or into some valley. And he said, Ye shall not send. ▼
▼ strong…: Heb. sons of strength
 , ▼
▼ some mountain: Heb. one of the mountains

tokens.text: unto him, Behold now, there be

footnotes.body_html: ▼ strong…: Heb. sons of strength

footnotes.body_text: ▼ some mountain: Heb. one of the mountains
footnotes.body_html: ▼ some mountain: Heb. one of the mountains

verses.text_plain: And when they urged him till he was ashamed, he said, Send. They sent therefore fifty men; and they sought three days, but found him not.
verses.verse_html: 17And when they urged him till he was ashamed, he said, Send. They sent therefore fifty men; and they sought three days, but found him not.

verses.text_plain: And when they came again to him, (for he tarried at Jericho,) he said unto them, Did I not say unto you, Go not?
verses.verse_html: 18And when they came again to him, (for he tarried at Jericho,) he said unto them, Did I not say unto you, Go not?

tokens.text: unto them, Did I not say

verses.text_plain: And the men of the city said unto Elisha, Behold, I pray thee, the situation of this city is pleasant, as my lord seeth: but the water is naught, and the ground barren.
verses.verse_html:
19And the men of the city said unto Elisha, Behold, I pray thee, the situation of this city is pleasant, as my lord seeth: but the water is naught, and the ground barren. ▼
▼ barren: Heb. causing to miscarry

tokens.text: Behold, I pray thee, the situation

footnotes.body_html: ▼ barren: Heb. causing to miscarry

verses.text_plain: And he said, Bring me a new cruse, and put salt therein. And they brought it to him.
verses.verse_html: 20And he said, Bring me a new cruse, and put salt therein. And they brought it to him.

verses.text_plain: And he went forth unto the spring of the waters, and cast the salt in there, and said, Thus saith the Lord, I have healed these waters; there shall not be from thence any more death or barren land.
verses.verse_html: 21And he went forth unto the spring of the waters, and cast the salt in there, and said, Thus saith the Lord, I have healed these waters; there shall not be from thence any more death or barren land.

tokens.text: there shall not be from thence any more death

verses.text_plain: So the waters were healed unto this day, according to the saying of Elisha which he spake.
verses.verse_html: 22So the waters were healed unto this day, according to the saying of Elisha which he spake.

verses.text_plain: And he went up from thence unto Beth–el: and as he was going up by the way, there came forth little children out of the city, and mocked him, and said unto him, Go up, thou bald head; go up, thou bald head.
verses.verse_html: 23And he went up from thence unto Beth–el: and as he was going up by the way, there came forth little children out of the city, and mocked him, and said unto him, Go up, thou bald head; go up, thou bald head.

tokens.text: and as he was going up

verses.text_plain: And he turned back, and looked on them, and cursed them in the name of the Lord. And there came forth two she bears out of the wood, and tare forty and two children of them.
verses.verse_html: 24And he turned back, and looked on them, and cursed them in the name of the Lord. And there came forth two she bears out of the wood, and tare forty and two children of them.

verses.text_plain: And he went from thence to mount Carmel, and from thence he returned to Samaria.
verses.verse_html: 25And he went from thence to mount Carmel, and from thence he returned to Samaria.
